The space: Simple, classy, rustic yet subtly contemporary, everything we needed for a peaceful retreat from the rush of life. The space feels large the way it is laid out, the kitchen has just enough to be fully functional and still keep it simple and easy. It's neither home nor hotel, but clearly an open space meant to comfortably hold someone seeking quiet and simplicity.
The hosts: GENEROUS, genuinely kind and available but not imposing or in any way pushy. We made some amazing memories with this family, and we also had ample time to soak up and bond ourselves. I stayed here with my two young daughters, the space was safe for us and spacious enough for lots of creative play (indoors and outdoors).
I've never had a better AirBnB experience. I've liked past places, but as a lover of quiet rural existences this space was perfection.
To the tech-driven: If you're looking to be on devices the whole time, you may be looking at the wrong place. The internet is sufficient but basic (I joined a Zoom call and was able to see and hear but not easily be heard (could have called in by phone for that, Verizon cell service at 2 bars), movie streaming was perfect and videos emailed fine).
Being PRESENT in body and place is what I feel this spot most invites of its visitors. A wonderful breath of fresh air to connect to place, people, self and family here. [And feel well rested! I slept better than I've slept in a year in that bed.]

I’m not one to write phony, glowing reviews, so I’ll wrap this up succinctly.
The neighborhood is quaint and quiet with an easy walk to the downtown square, where you’ll find sufficient places for food/beer and morning coffee/breakfast.
You’ll sleep fine in your choice of a northeast or southeast facing bedroom. (Put the ugly step child in the middle room.)
TVs are provided in the living room and bedroom(s). Typical access to streaming services.
Easy-peasy. Enjoy the Midwest. We’re Midwest-nice.

Darling cottage in a secluded corner of a larger, well gardened property on the eastern edge of the WIU campus area. We had an extended stay here and the house was fully equipped for basic needs—we even baked cookies.
Excellent walkability to the Amtrak station, Forgottonia microbrewery, and Bold drive thru/walk up coffee shop, with the quaint & historic Macomb town square farmer's market just a few steps further. The house is comfortable for 2, a little tight for 4 adults for more than a week. Kitchen is well stocked, heat and AC are excellent, internet is solid (unusual for Macomb, which can be spotty).
This is a vintage, cutely updated & modernized, Gunnison "Magic" Kit prefab home from the 50's that has unusual build details, if you are curious about that sort of thing. It is about 1/4 mile from the train tracks, but the only noticeable sound is an occasional whistle, not the rumble. Being near campus, there are pedestrians and the occasional "boom" car, but they're only audible if the windows are open. Convenient off-street parking, right next to the house.
